intro: Montigena novae-zelandiae, commonly known as the New Zealand montigena, is a rare flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its delicate, umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and flies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
